idiom.trgText: Très commun et facile à trouver
idiom.srcExample: Those cheap souvenirs are a dime a dozen at tourist markets.

idiom.trgText: En bonne santé et plein d'énergie
idiom.literalTranslation: Vivant et donnant des coups de pied
idiom.srcExample: Despite his age, grandpa is still alive and kicking.

idiom.trgText: Estimation ou chiffre approximatif
idiom.srcExample: We don’t need exact numbers yet; a ballpark figure will be enough for now.

idiom.trgText: Discuter d'une question déjà réglée ou irréversible
idiom.srcExample: Stop beating a dead horse; we all know the event didn’t go as planned.

idiom.trgText: Accepter une situation pénible considérée comme inévitable
idiom.srcExample: They didn’t want to sell their house, but they bit the bullet to pay off their debts.

idiom.trgText: Un mal pour un bien
idiom.srcExample: Their flight being overbooked was a blessing in disguise; they got upgraded to first class on the next one.

idiom.trgText: Étudier ou travailler tard dans la nuit
idiom.srcExample: To finish the project on time, he had to burn the midnight oil.

idiom.trgText: Possibilité de repartir à zéro
idiom.srcExample: Moving to a new city felt like a clean slate for her.

idiom.trgText: Faire un travail peu soigné; prendre des raccourcis
idiom.srcExample: The company tried to cut corners to save money, but it led to customer complaints.

idiom.trgText: Parler directement du point essentiel
idiom.srcExample: Let’s cut to the chase—are you interested in buying the car or not?

idiom.trgText: Plus tard dans une séquence ou dans le temps
idiom.srcExample: If you save money now, you’ll thank yourself down the line.

idiom.trgText: Problème évident ignoré par tous
idiom.srcExample: During the meeting, nobody addressed the elephant in the room: the company’s financial problems.

idiom.trgText: Personne tenue responsable d'une faute pour protéger le véritable coupable
idiom.srcExample: He was the fall guy when the project failed, even though it wasn't just his fault.

idiom.trgText: En excellente forme physique
idiom.srcExample: Even at 70 years old, he’s still fit as a fiddle and goes jogging every morning.

idiom.trgText: De la source originale, de la personne concernée
idiom.literalTranslation: Directement de la bouche du cheval
idiom.srcExample: If you don’t believe me, ask her directly and get it from the horse’s mouth.

idiom.trgText: Ignorer volontairement quelqu'un
idiom.srcExample: He tried to apologize, but she just gave him the cold shoulder and walked away.

idiom.trgText: Faire plus que ce qui est attendu ou requis
idiom.srcExample: The hotel staff went the extra mile by decorating our room for our anniversary.

idiom.trgText: Aller se coucher, aller dormir
idiom.srcExample: After a long day of work, I just need to hit the sack.

idiom.trgText: Demander à quelqu'un d'attendre ou de ne pas se précipiter
idiom.srcExample: Hold your horses! We should review all the options before choosing one.

idiom.srcText: kill two birds with one stone
idiom.trgText: Accomplir deux choses en même temps
idiom.literalTranslation: Tuer deux oiseaux avec une pierre
idiom.srcExample: He combines his morning run with walking the dog, killing two birds with one stone.

idiom.trgText: Éviter de relancer une vieille dispute
idiom.literalTranslation: Laisser que les chiens endormis se reposent
idiom.srcExample: Bringing up that argument again will only lead to more problems—let sleeping dogs lie.

idiom.trgText: À merveille, très bien
idiom.srcExample: She and her new roommate got along like a house on fire from the very first day.

idiom.trgText: Évaluer les risques potentiels avant d'agir
idiom.srcExample: Always look before you leap when making major financial decisions.

idiom.trgText: Rater une opportunité ou occasion
idiom.srcExample: If you don't apply for the job now, you might miss the boat.

idiom.trgText: Sans conditions ni obligations
idiom.srcExample: She offered to help with no strings attached, just because she wanted to be kind.

idiom.trgText: Reporté pour plus tard, jugé non prioritaire
idiom.srcExample: Let’s put this discussion on the back burner for now and focus on the main issue.

idiom.trgText: Attentif, efficace et performant
idiom.srcExample: John is always on the ball when it comes to managing his team.

idiom.trgText: En situation risquée ou précaire
idiom.srcExample: John, after that mistake, you are on thin ice with the boss.

idiom.trgText: De manière inattendue ou sans indication préalable
idiom.srcExample: He quit his job out of the blue, shocking everyone at the office.

idiom.trgText: Hors de danger ou de situations difficiles
idiom.srcExample: The doctors said she’s finally out of the woods after weeks of intensive care.

idiom.trgText: Pluie très forte et soudaine
idiom.literalTranslation: Il pleut des chats et des chiens
idiom.srcExample: It's raining cats and dogs, we need to take an umbrella.

idiom.trgText: Bureaucratie, lourdeurs administratives
idiom.srcExample: The company couldn't hire anyone quickly because of all the red tape in the hiring process.

idiom.trgText: Avoir des points de vue communs, s'entendre bien
idiom.srcExample: We rarely see eye to eye on movies; she loves dramas, and I prefer comedies.

idiom.trgText: Rester neutre sur un sujet donné
idiom.srcExample: The politician was criticized for sitting on the fence instead of taking a clear position on the issue.

idiom.trgText: Enchaînement d'événements menant à un mauvais résultat
idiom.srcExample: By neglecting regular maintenance, you’re on a slippery slope to costly repairs.

idiom.trgText: Conversation banale pour combler les silences
idiom.srcExample: We made small talk about the weather while waiting for the meeting to start.

idiom.trgText: Soupçonner, entrevoir quelque chose de louche
idiom.srcExample: I could smell a rat when they offered such a high salary for an entry-level job.

idiom.trgText: Un point fort ou un atout
idiom.srcExample: Writing is her strong suit, she could become a writer.

idiom.trgText: Cacher un problème pour éviter d'y faire face
idiom.srcExample: The company tried to sweep the scandal under the rug, but the media found out about it.

idiom.trgText: Ce qui rend une situation insupportable, le comble
idiom.srcExample: I could tolerate the bad service, but finding a hair in my food was the last straw.

idiom.trgText: Plus il y a de monde, plus l'activité est agréable
idiom.literalTranslation: Plus (il y en a), plus (c'est) joyeux
idiom.srcExample: There’s plenty of food for everyone, so feel free to bring more guests. The more the merrier!

idiom.trgText: Dans les bons et les mauvais moments
idiom.literalTranslation: À travers les épais et les fins
idiom.srcExample: A real friend remains by your side through thick and thin, not just when life is easy.

idiom.trgText: Agir sans tenir compte des dangers potentiels ou les ignorer
idiom.srcExample: She decided to throw caution to the wind and invest all her savings in the startup.

idiom.trgText: Aggraver une mauvaise situation préexistante
idiom.srcExample: The company fired him, and to add insult to injury, they refused to pay any compensation.

idiom.trgText: Contacter pour une consultation ou un suivi
idiom.srcExample: I’ll touch base with you later to discuss the project details.

idiom.trgText: Légèrement malade ou mal en point
idiom.srcExample: I think I caught a cold; I’ve been under the weather since yesterday.

idiom.trgText: Avec scepticisme et prudence
idiom.srcExample: The news seemed too good to be true, so I took it with a grain of salt.

idiom.trgText: Avec un succès total ou remarquable
idiom.srcExample: Despite the difficulty of the course, he passed it with flying colors.

idiom.trgText: Comprendre quelque chose de difficile ou complexe
idiom.srcExample: It's hard to wrap your head around quantum physics.

idiom.trgText: Refuser une invitation avec l'intention implicite de l'accepter plus tard
idiom.srcExample: I'll have to take a rain check on the museum visit; my schedule is packed.

idiom.trgText: Rire de manière incontrôlable à cause de quelque chose de très drôle
idiom.srcExample: His animated recounting of the day's events had us all in stitches.

idiom.trgText: Explication, idée ou argument logique
idiom.srcExample: When examined closely, none of these arguments hold water.

idiom.trgText: Faire de son mieux ou montrer la meilleure version de soi-même
idiom.literalTranslation: Mettre son meilleur pied en avant
idiom.srcExample: In a new relationship, it's natural to want to put your best foot forward.

idiom.trgText: Dans un état très dégradé, sur le point de ne plus fonctionner
idiom.srcExample: The once-thriving factory is now on its last legs, facing closure soon.

idiom.trgText: Je suis totalement d'accord  Tu l'as dit
idiom.srcExample: You can say that again, that movie was absolutely fantastic.
